Templates.template:
new sap.ui.integration.Extension(
	"${sId}", // string
	{
		id: ${id}, // sap.ui.core.ID
		models: ${models}, // object
		bindingContexts: ${bindingContexts}, // object
		objectBindings: ${objectBindings}, // object
		metadataContexts: ${metadataContexts}, // object
		validationSuccess: [function (oEvent) {}, this], // function|array
		validationError: [function (oEvent) {}, this], // function|array
		parseError: [function (oEvent) {}, this], // function|array
		formatError: [function (oEvent) {}, this], // function|array
		modelContextChange: [function (oEvent) {}, this], // function|array
		actions: [${actions}], // array
		action: [function (oEvent) {}, this] // function|array
	}
)
Templates.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new Extension. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getActions actions} : array
  • Events
    • {@link #event:action action} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor sap.ui.base.ManagedObject} can be used as well.
Templates.name: sap.ui.integration.Extension
Templates.helpDescription: Provides additional functions and services to an integration card.

Templates.name: sap.ui.integration.Extension.fireAction
Templates.helpDescription: Experimental!

Templates.template:
new sap.ui.integration.Host(
	"${sId}", // string
	{
		id: ${id}, // sap.ui.core.ID
		models: ${models}, // object
		bindingContexts: ${bindingContexts}, // object
		objectBindings: ${objectBindings}, // object
		metadataContexts: ${metadataContexts}, // object
		validationSuccess: [function (oEvent) {}, this], // function|array
		validationError: [function (oEvent) {}, this], // function|array
		parseError: [function (oEvent) {}, this], // function|array
		formatError: [function (oEvent) {}, this], // function|array
		modelContextChange: [function (oEvent) {}, this], // function|array
		actions: [${actions}], // array
		action: [function (oEvent) {}, this], // function|array
		resolveDestination: ${fn_resolveDestination} // function
	}
)
Templates.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new Host. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getResolveDestination resolveDestination} : function
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.integration.Extension#constructor sap.ui.integration.Extension} can be used as well.
Templates.name: sap.ui.integration.Host
Templates.helpDescription:
Provides application-level functions and services to an integration card.

Examples may include, but are not limited to options like: share a card, remove a card.

Templates.template:
new sap.ui.integration.widgets.Card(
	"${sId}", // string
	{
		id: ${id}, // sap.ui.core.ID
		models: ${models}, // object
		bindingContexts: ${bindingContexts}, // object
		objectBindings: ${objectBindings}, // object
		metadataContexts: ${metadataContexts}, // object
		validationSuccess: [function (oEvent) {}, this], // function|array
		validationError: [function (oEvent) {}, this], // function|array
		parseError: [function (oEvent) {}, this], // function|array
		formatError: [function (oEvent) {}, this], // function|array
		modelContextChange: [function (oEvent) {}, this], // function|array
		tooltip: ${tooltip}, // sap.ui.core.TooltipBase
		customData: [${customData}], // sap.ui.core.CustomData[]
		layoutData: ${layoutData}, // sap.ui.core.LayoutData
		dependents: [${dependents}], // sap.ui.core.Element[]
		dragDropConfig: [${dragDropConfig}], // sap.ui.core.dnd.DragDropBase[]
		blocked: ${bBlocked}, // boolean
		busy: ${bBusy}, // boolean
		busyIndicatorDelay: ${1000}, // int
		busyIndicatorSize: ${sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium}, // sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize
		visible: ${bVisible}, // boolean
		fieldGroupIds: ${[]}, // string[]
		validateFieldGroup: [function (oEvent) {}, this], // function|array
		manifest: ${""}, // any
		parameters: ${parameters}, // object
		width: ${"100%"}, // sap.ui.core.CSSSize
		height: ${"auto"}, // sap.ui.core.CSSSize
		dataMode: ${sap.ui.integration.CardDataMode.Active}, // sap.ui.integration.CardDataMode
		baseUrl: ${baseUrl}, // sap.ui.core.URI
		manifestChanges: [${manifestChanges}], // object[]
		hostConfigurationId: ${hostConfigurationId}, // (sap.ui.core.Control|string)
		host: ${host}, // (sap.ui.core.Control|string)
		action: [function (oEvent) {}, this], // function|array
		manifestReady: [function (oEvent) {}, this] // function|array
	}
)
Templates.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new Card. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getManifest manifest} : any (default: )
    • {@link #getParameters parameters} : object
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: 100%)
    • {@link #getHeight height} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: auto)
    • {@link #getDataMode dataMode} : sap.ui.integration.CardDataMode (default: Active)
    • {@link #getBaseUrl baseUrl} : sap.ui.core.URI
    • {@link #getManifestChanges manifestChanges} : object[]
  • Aggregations
  • Associations
    • {@link #getHostConfigurationId hostConfigurationId} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)
    • {@link #getHost host} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:action action} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:manifestReady manifestReady} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
Templates.name: sap.ui.integration.widgets.Card
Templates.helpDescription:
A control that represents a container with a header and content.

Overview

Cards are small user interface elements which provide the most important information from an app, related to a specific role or task. The information is represented in a compact manner, allowing for actions to be executed. Cards can be described as small representations of an app which can be integrated in different systems. The integration card is defined in a declarative way, using a manifest.json to be:
  • Easily integrated into apps
  • Easily reused across apps
  • Understandable by other technologies
  • Self-contained (has a built-in functionality and doesn't need external configuration)
  • Dynamic parameter handling
  • Clear separation of the roles of the card and app developers
The role of the card developer is to describe the card in a manifest.json file and define:
  • Header
  • Content
  • Data source
  • Possible actions
The role of the app developer is to integrate the card into the app and define:
  • The dimensions of the card inside a layout of choice, using the width and height properties
  • The behavior for the actions described in the manifest.json file, using the action event
You can learn more about integration cards in the Card Explorer When to use
  • When you want to reuse the card across apps.
  • When you need easy integration and configuration.
When not to use
  • When you need more header and content flexibility.
  • When you have to achieve simple card visualization. For such cases, use: {@link sap.f.Card sap.f.Card}.
  • When you have to use an application model. For such cases, use: {@link sap.f.Card sap.f.Card}.
  • When you need complex behavior. For such cases, use: {@link sap.f.Card sap.f.Card}.

Templates.name: sap.ui.integration.widgets.Card.fireAction
